00050 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00051  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00052  * @retval  None
00053  ************************************************************************************************************/
00054 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00055 {
00056   #if 1
00057 
00058   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00059   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00060   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00061   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00062   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00063   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00064   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00065   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00066   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00067   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00068   {
00069   }
00070   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00071   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00072   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00073   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00074   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00075 
00076   #else
00077 
00078   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00080   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00081   NVIC_SystemReset();
00082 
00083   #endif
00084 }
00085 
00086 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00087  * @brief   This function handles SysTick Handler.
00088  * @retval  None
00089  ************************************************************************************************************/
00090 void SysTick_Handler(void)
00091 {
00092   if (gI2S_RateProcessDownCnt)
00093     gI2S_RateProcessDownCnt--;
00094 }
00095 
00096 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00097  * @brief   This function handles I2C interrupt.
00098  * @retval  None
00099  ************************************************************************************************************/
00100 void HTCFG_FUN_I2C_IRQ(void)
00101 {
00102   extern I2CM_TransferType I2CM_Transfer;
00103   u32 state = I2CM->SR;
00104   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00105 
00106   I2CM->SR = state;
00107 
00108   /* Check BUS error condition                                                                              */
00109   if (state & I2C_FLAG_BUSERR)
00110   {
00111     pTransfer->Status = I2CM_BUSERR;
00112     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00113   }
00114 
00115   /* Check Arbitration Loss condition                                                                       */
00116   if (state & I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS)
00117   {
00118     pTransfer->Status = I2CM_ARBLOS;
00119     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00120   }
00121 
00122   /* Check Timeout condition                                                                                */
00123   if (state & I2C_FLAG_TOUTF)
00124   {
00125     pTransfer->Status = I2CM_TOUTF;
00126     goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00127   }
00128 
00129   /* Check NACK condition                                                                                   */
00130   if (state & I2C_FLAG_RXNACK)
00131   {
00132     if (pTransfer->RetryDownCounter)
00133     {
00134       pTransfer->RetryDownCounter--;
00135       I2C_TargetAddressConfig(I2CM, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00136       return;
00137     }
00138     else
00139     {
00140       pTransfer->Status = I2CM_SLAVE_NO_RESPONSE;
00141       goto i2c_master_transfer_error;
00142     }
00143   }
00144 
00145   if (pTransfer->Buffer)
00146   {
00147     switch (state)
00148     {
00149       /*-----------------------------Master Transmitter ----------------------------------------------------*/
00150       case I2C_MASTER_SEND_START:
00151         break;
00152 
00153       case I2C_MASTER_TRANSMITTER_MODE:
00154           /* Send the register address to I2C                                                               */
00155           if (pTransfer->RegAddrMode == I2CM_WORD_ADDR_MODE_2BYTE)
00156           {
00157             I2CM->DR = pTransfer->RegAddr >> 8;
00158             pTransfer->IsRegAddrSent = FALSE;
00159           }
00160           else
00161           {
00162             I2CM->DR = pTransfer->RegAddr;
00163             pTransfer->IsRegAddrSent = TRUE;
00164           }
00165         break;
00166 
00167       case I2C_MASTER_TX_EMPTY:
00168           if (pTransfer->IsRegAddrSent)
00169           {
00170             if (pTransfer->Direction == I2CM_DIRECTION_OUT)
00171             {
00172               if (pTransfer->Counter < pTransfer->Length)
00173               {
00174                 I2CM->DR = pTransfer->Buffer[pTransfer->Counter++];
00175               }
00176               else
00177               {
00178                 pTransfer->Status = I2CM_OK;
00179                 /* Send I2C STOP condition                                                                  */
00180                 I2C_GenerateSTOP(I2CM);
00181                 pTransfer->Buffer = NULL;
00182                 if (pTransfer->TransferEndCallback != NULL)
00183                 {
00184                   pTransfer->TransferEndCallback();
00185                 }
00186               }
00187             }
00188             else
00189             {
00190               /* Send Repeated Start to change the I2C transfer direction                                   */
00191               I2C_TargetAddressConfig(I2CM, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_READ);
00192             }
00193           }
00194           else
00195           {
00196             I2CM->DR = pTransfer->RegAddr & 0xFF;
00197             pTransfer->IsRegAddrSent = TRUE;
00198           }
00199         break;
00200 
00201       /*-----------------------------Master Receiver -------------------------------------------------------*/
00202       case I2C_MASTER_RECEIVER_MODE:
00203           /* Enable I2CM ACK for receiving data                                                             */
00204           if (pTransfer->Length > 1)
00205           {
00206             I2C_AckCmd(I2CM, ENABLE);
00207           }
00208         break;
00209 
00210       case I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY:
00211           /* Receive data sent from I2C                                                                     */
00212           pTransfer->Buffer[pTransfer->Counter++] = I2CM->DR;
00213           if (pTransfer->Counter == pTransfer->Length - 1)
00214           {
00215             /* Disable I2CM ACK                                                                             */
00216             I2C_AckCmd(I2CM, DISABLE);
00217           }
00218           if (pTransfer->Counter == pTransfer->Length)
00219           {
00220             pTransfer->Status = I2CM_OK;
00221             /* Send I2C STOP condition                                                                      */
00222             I2C_GenerateSTOP(I2CM);
00223             pTransfer->Buffer = NULL;
00224             if (pTransfer->TransferEndCallback != NULL)
00225             {
00226               pTransfer->TransferEndCallback();
00227             }
00228           }
00229         break;
00230 
00231        default:
00232         I2CM_DBG_PRINTF("Undefine State %08X\r\n", state);
00233         break;
00234     }
00235     return;
00236   }
00237   else
00238   {
00239     pTransfer->Status = I2CM_BUFFER_NULL;
00240   }
00241 
00242 i2c_master_transfer_error:
00243   /* Send I2C STOP condition                                                                                */
00244   I2C_GenerateSTOP(I2CM);
00245   pTransfer->Buffer = NULL;
00246 }
00247 
00248 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00249  * @brief   This function handles I2S interrupt.
00250  * @retval  None
00251  ************************************************************************************************************/
00252 void I2S_IRQHandler(void)
00253 {
00254   if (I2S_GetFlagStatus(I2S_FLAG_TXFIFO_UDF) == SET)
00255   {
00256     printf(" TU");
00257     while (1);
00258   }
00259 
00260   if (I2S_GetFlagStatus(I2S_FLAG_RXFIFO_OVF) == SET)
00261   {
00262     printf(" RO");
00263     while (1);
00264   }
00265 }
00266 
00267 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00268  * @brief   This function handles PDMA CH2~5 interrupt.
00269  * @retval  None
00270  ************************************************************************************************************/
00271 void PDMA_CH2_5_IRQHandler(void)
00272 {
00273   FlagStatus isTransferComplete = PDMA_GetFlagStatus(PDMA_CH2, PDMA_FLAG_TC);
00274 
00275   PDMA_ClearFlag(PDMA_CH2, PDMA_FLAG_GE);
00276 
00277   I2S_BufferRead((u32*)&TxBuf[AltBuf][0]);
00278   if (isTransferComplete == RESET)
00279   {
00280     AltBuf = 0;
00281   }
00282   else
00283   {
00284     AltBuf = 1;
00285   }
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00289  * @brief   This function handles USB interrupt.
00290  * @retval  None
00291  ************************************************************************************************************/
00292 void USB_IRQHandler(void)
00293 {
00294   __ALIGN4 extern USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00295   USBDCore_IRQHandler(&gUSBCore);
00296 }
